subject: Sales
title: The Camp David Accords
description: A quick, practical guide to The Camp David Accords.

hook.text: Egypt and Israel fought four wars in 30 years. Peace seemed impossible until three men tried.

buildup.text: Carter brought Sadat and Begin to Camp David for 13 days of intense, isolated negotiation.

discovery.text: Carter focused on interests, not positions. Egypt wanted Sinai back. Israel wanted security.

twist.text: Both leaders nearly walked out multiple times. Carter shuttled between cabins to keep talks alive.

climax.text: Egypt got Sinai. Israel got diplomatic recognition. Both won what they valued most.

punchline.text: Thirteen days of patience ended thirty years of war.

quiz.question: What negotiation principle made Camp David succeed?
options: Focusing on interests rather than positions
